document.title: TEXAS ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS FOR PHYSICAL EDUCATION

F7EEBE9D72CA40EA959EE28A1439D883.description: analyze the level of personal enjoyment in a variety of activities in the school and community.

2F9D6EA998B3418AB6AF79CF30555EE1.description: differentiate among types of and participate in moderate to vigorous physical activity for a sustained period of time on a regular basis using technology when available; and

F3058FC5C1BF4D9A8C2E0E56D6ED6CC3.description: Lifetime wellness--application of lifetime wellness. The physically literate student identifies the value of lifetime wellness. The student is expected to:

C12EC7C0E2924428A4577EC3D810B8E5.description: Social and emotional health--accepting and providing constructive feedback. The physically literate student accepts and provides constructive feedback. The student is expected to apply appropriate changes to performance based on feedback from peers.

4B328BEC5764401980F25E90E159B884.description: Social and emotional health--perseverance. The physically literate student perseveres while addressing challenges. The student is expected to discuss the importance of accepting individual challenges and use self-management skills to persevere in a positive manner during dynamic activities and lead-up games.

A1D98CEFB4C24F4C94660482E464FAFF.description: identify and describe the concepts of empathy and mutual respect for the feelings of others.

CF82480EE84449D79B1E2267C7F91923.description: identify and describe effective communication to enhance healthy interactions while settling disagreements; and

809CECF5BE3E49C382B1EF47B137080D.description: explain the importance of and demonstrate how to resolve conflict in socially acceptable ways and respond to winning and losing with dignity and understanding;

CF1D0791421F4151AD1BD195EF2BBC0E.description: Social and emotional health--resolving conflict and social interaction. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in resolving conflict and social interaction. The student is expected to:

E595DFF83FEB40F088A490FFCA137F37.description: apply self-management skills to demonstrate self-control of impulses and emotions during dynamic activities and lead-up games.

D3996FA3A53F4531ABB0C90325BC5216.description: accept responsibility and demonstrate respect for differences and similarities in abilities of self and others during dynamic activities and lead-up games; and

06747378EDA94E51BFB78018AB02D20F.description: accept and take responsibility for personal actions that affect self and others during dynamic activities and lead-up games;

CE1CEC771EFF48DA8D530505C90D383F.description: Social and emotional health--personal responsibility and self-management. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in personal responsibility. The student is expected to:

A07F5C8E63414E039ABD9F21ED3552E7.description: demonstrate correct safety precautions, including water, sun, cycling, skating, and scooter safety.

DEB3D474B1874877BA3E2F5FC395AC88.description: describe and select proper attire and safety equipment that promote safe participation and prevent injury in dynamic activities and games; and

1E68956F447B4D839AD982D9A485451A.description: Health, physical activity, and fitness--environmental awareness and safety practices. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in environmental awareness and understands safety practices. The student is expected to:

B33C0A0C23C849739FBACB374C5A650A.description: explain the importance of proper hydration before, during, and after physical activity.

4DA9E0CB0222412381F09BE032A6AB7A.description: identify healthy foods that enhance physical activity; and

C1F365C2D41A412CB4C208C40E11378E.description: Health, physical activity, and fitness--nutrition and hydration. The physically literate student recognizes the correlation between nutrition, hydration, and physical activity. The student is expected to:Â

237392A5A29D472AB9C7504FEE897E2B.description: track progress and analyze data, with teacher guidance, to target areas needing improvement.

C08F633728CA4D49A106BDD08C71CDEE.description: analyze personal fitness goals for self-improvement; and

9248D06928ED463EB05A2BDD6D84E892.description: Health, physical activity, and fitness--analyze data. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in the ability to analyze data used during fitness performance. The student is expected to:

7C3B36D367184E42B742EE416010CB21.description: differentiate between health-related and skill-related fitness components.

58FEBE7E963348899512BEBBC21E7C1C.description: describe the frequency, intensity, time, and type (FITT) principle and how it improves fitness; and

39E3EE998C3D42C69C700796610EC399.description: describe the benefits of moderate to vigorous physical activity on overall health and wellness;

53DEC25EA1314B7D823D92D3EF89B32E.description: Health, physical activity, and fitness--fitness principles. The physically literate student demonstrates and recognizes a health-enhancing, physically active lifestyle. The student is expected to:

AA7044B35B0C4A378B3C9C80835FB8D7.description: Performance strategies--outdoor and recreational pursuits. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in outdoor and recreational pursuits. The student is expected to participate in outdoor recreational skills and activities such as rock climbing, orienteering, hiking, paddle sports, archery, cycling, or challenge courses.

60DE3641A05845449C5A454008E35634.description: engage appropriately in physical activity, sporting behavior, and game etiquette without teacher cue.

6A462F9113A34AD489D843D795A5462E.description: demonstrate specific movement skills in designated dynamic activities and lead-up games with a partner or group; and

CB6283A33EAE4018909B8E60C8088191.description: identify and demonstrate the relationships among a variety of game skills, including preparation, movement, follow-through, and recovery, used in net or wall, invasion, target, fielding, or striking games;

574153F18D2C460C90DE53E117C1D706.description: Performance strategies--games and activities. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in performance strategies in invasion, target, net or wall, fielding, striking, and cooperative games. The student is expected to:

2F5BEB0279DE4953AC930416AA24AA5A.description: Movement patterns and movement skills--rhythmic activities. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in rhythmic activities and rhythmic combinations. The student is expected to create rhythmic routines in counts of eight using basic steps and coordinated movement patterns individually or in a group.

36960A8895A64C30A2EA8C7026C298CE.description: apply speed, direction, and force with a short-handled implement during dynamic activities and lead-up games.

BA203CEF76AD4AA29E2DB62903A06A89.description: apply appropriate use of pathways and levels in small groups during dynamic activities and lead-up games; and

52B0ECEA88074B31B27627E66E05A0CC.description: demonstrate the appropriate use of open space and closing space in small groups during dynamic activities and lead-up games;

7B272EF829D54C8FA89AFC0ED615D7BB.description: Movement patterns and movement skills--spatial and body awareness. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in spatial and body awareness, including pathways, shapes, levels, speed, direction, and force. The student is expected to:

366C4769524D46F98339DA6BBE9BBB6B.description: demonstrate entering and exiting a turned long rope using advanced jumping skills.

FD10F7EC9AC24F66B917F0BF56C4EF08.description: jump a self-turned rope in a routine using a variety of advanced skills; and

F7C4CB99C70441DFA875BE3D121F81FC.description: demonstrate correct technique when striking an object with a hand or short- or long-handled implement in dynamic activities and lead-up games;

AAB26007C1874806A135B1D62475507B.description: demonstrate correct technique in volleying in dynamic activities and lead-up games;

F94606CC59E646F8A61BB9A366AE26BC.description: demonstrate appropriate form when kicking and punting during dynamic activities and lead-up games;

166B8226BE25482684446F3ED4E3563C.description: combine foot dribbling with other skills during dynamic activities and lead-up games;

EF15A3ED01EF40B8B2A72C14F9D62DAC.description: demonstrate key elements of hand dribbling with either hand when stationary while protecting the ball from a defender during dynamic activities and lead-up games;

6CD796BAE5E849F5989AAC0E9944B2C2.description: demonstrate the key elements of catching while moving during games and activities;

FBC37B01DAF04B15816CD2B79606C83D.description: demonstrate the key elements of manipulative skills, including eye on target, follow-through, body weight transfer, and body position, during games and activities;

CBAFBC726F024224A92B1FDF9FDA1D0D.description: Movement patterns and movement skills--manipulative skills. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in developmentally appropriate manipulative skills. The student is expected to:

3524CCF307EB4830A8B51F20A1503C40.description: perform a combination of bending, stretching, twisting, curling, pushing, pulling, and swaying in a variety of activities.

FB1D966FAE5F4F1B82CEC74A7BA87F72.description: maintain balance and transfer body weight with control during dynamic activities and lead-up games; and

F10FE64636E643DEAAFEEF58FA7FB61E.description: Movement patterns and movement skills--non-locomotor skills. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in fundamental movement patterns and developmentally appropriate non-locomotor skills. The student is expected to:

A294435FBAC8437B8A2D89DDEA5A3845.description: demonstrate advanced balancing to include equipment, cross lateralization during increasingly complex movements, and sequencing of four or more skills with repetition.

5ADC2745B6424A18A66ABA2E3AB2A47C.description: demonstrate correct jumping and landing technique while performing a long jump and a full turn jump in both directions; and

DBFE7760CC784D36A8431486BFCFFC87.description: demonstrate and apply correct technique in a variety of locomotor skills and combinations during lead-up activities;

55BF76C142024162ABDAC992E75F8A7E.description: Movement patterns and movement skills--locomotor skills. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in fundamental movement patterns and developmentally appropriate locomotor skills. The student is expected to:
